text: Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani is a notable Iranian author, translator, essayist, journalist, women's rights activistNoushin Ahmadi Khorasani and community activist.Noushin Ahmadi KhorasaniShe is one of the founding members of the One Million Signatures campaign.PBS's Frontline: Courageous and Principled: Shiva Nazar Ahari. She was also a founder of Women's Cultural Center. (Markaz-e Farhangi-ye Zanan). The Women's Cultural Center is an "NGO that focuses on women's health, as well as legal issues"."Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani: Two Decades in the Struggle For Women's Rights" : Khorasani also wrote several books about the women's movement in Iran.Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani Khorasani was the 2004 winner of the Latifeh Yarshater Award, given by the Persian Heritage Foundation, for a book she co-authored with Parvin Ardalan about the country's first female lawyer, Mehrangiz Manouchehrian, titled "Senator: the Work of Senator Mehrangiz Manouchehrian in the Struggle for Legal Rights for Women". Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani ==Activism== In 2007 she, together with Parvin Ardalan, was sentenced to three years in prison for "threatening the national security."Civil Society in Comparative Muslim Contexts: Debating Women: Gender and the Public Sphere in Post-Revolutionary Iran. Ziba Mir- Hosseini, 2002. Khorasani was released on 22 September 2010 after she appeared before the Evin Prison Court "to provide some explanations," and was informed of her charges.Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani Khorasani was interrogated when she first appeared in court on Tuesday following a summons, and was asked to return the next day to meet with "case analysts." On 23 September, she was informed of her charges of "propagation activities against the regime through: (a) writing and publishing content against the regime on the Feminist School website,Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani and (b) participation in the illegal gatherings after the 2009 elections,".Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani After being informed of her charges, Khorasani defended herself and she was released to a custodian. She was released until her trial date.Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani Khorasani's trial was held on 11 March 2012 in Branch 26 of the Islamic revolutionary court. On 9 June 2012, she was sentenced to one year of suspended imprisonment and five years of probation.Noushin Ahmadi Khorasani ==See also== *Iranian women's movement *Mina Ahadi *Sakineh Ashtiani *Shirin Ebadi *Marina Nemat ==References== Category:Iranian dissidents Category:Iranian women's rights activists Category:Iranian journalists Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Iranian women short story writers
